item.title: Understanding Event-Driven Metrics
item.description: Event-driven systems at the moment are dominating when it comes to software system design. Some of the characteristics of event-driven systems are asynchronous actions and eventual consistency. In traditional systems, each call will produce an immediate response. While in event-driven systems(EDS) the response is not immediate but it is made when the system is ready to process a call. The EDS is not easy to debug or predict the next state.
